comments.content:
I'd say Aura:  
 [http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/aura/at-aura/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130817100518/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/aura/at-aura/ "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/aura/at-aura/")  
or Anzeigen Grotesk:  
 [http://new.myfonts.com/search/Anzeigen+Grotesk/fonts/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130817100518/http:/new.myfonts.com/search/Anzeigen+Grotesk/fonts/ "http://new.myfonts.com/search/Anzeigen+Grotesk/fonts/")
I suspected those as well but neither sport the same "R". This "R" seems more condensed.
Also, I have Anziegen and did an overlay. They didn't match.

Haley created this thread based on a post I made in another forum. I finally heard back from my client who supplied these mock-ups and they said the font is [Block Gothic Extra Bold Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20130817100518/http:/www.ascenderfonts.com/font/block-gothic-extra-bold-condensed.aspx). Doesn't seem right at all. The "J" and "R" are off.
